alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with winds up to 45 mph will impact portions of southwestern Caribou, Oneida, Bannock, southeastern Power, Franklin and northwestern Bear Lake Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 958 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Preston to Malad to 6 miles southwest of Holbrook Summit. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Preston, Soda Springs, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Grace, Inkom, Downey, Arimo, Holbrook Summit, Thatcher, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Pleasantview, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Portneuf Gap, Virginia, Dayton, Clifton and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
